column4: You can specify the architecture of a package by for instance: sudo apt-get install whatever:i386 for32-bit or sudo apt-get install whatever:amd64 for 64-bit. Although why you would want to do that install a 32bit driver into a 64bit OS is puzzling.

You can specify the architecture of a package by for instance: sudo apt-get install whatever:i386 for32-bit or sudo apt-get install whatever:amd64 for 64-bit. Although why you would want to do that install a 32bit driver into a 64bit OS is puzzling.
